darija: achmen 7wayj khrin fl mo9errar kayjiwk S3ab?

eng: Hello, yes it's a lovely day.

eng: What do you do for a living?

eng: The ducks are pretty, particularly the males.
What do you do for a living?

eng: It protects me from social media intrusion.

eng: What subjects do you write about?

darija: ghadi ykhSni nkhelikom ntoma bjouj bo7dkom
eng: I'm gonna have to leave you two alone.

eng: I'm out of bread and it's getting late.

eng: Enjoy the rest of your day

eng: No, but the engineers who do the planes know what they're doing!
darija_ar: اللا, والاكين لموهانديسّين لي كايصايبو طييارات عارفين أش كايديرو!

darija: walakin wakha hakkak mazal hadchi kaykhle3.
eng: but it is still very scary.

eng: Yes, I take the plane very often.

eng: a sea of clouds to drown in

darija: hadchi cha3iri li katgoul, walakin rah machi ijabi!

eng: i'm sorry, i'm just not used to being in a plane.

darija: 3refti annaho Tol dial ri7la makaybeddel walo.

darija: i7Sa2ian, lksayd kaytraw 3adatan fl i9la3 o lhoboT.

darija: ghadi nhDer m3a chi wa7d li mSowe9 blm39ol
eng: I'm going to talk to someone who actually cares.

eng: But I can revise outside, there is not a lot of point being stuck in here
darija_ar: والاكين راه يمكن ليا نراجع برّا, ماكاينش لاش نبقا حاصلا هنا.

darija: o men fo9 hadchi ljow y9der ykhser.

darija: khoSoSan simana jaya, m7tajek diri wa7d l prezentaSion 3la lmawDo3 lli 3ziz 3lik.

darija_ar: خوصوصان سيمانا جايا, محتاجك ديري واحد ل پرزنتاصيون علا لماوضوع اللي عزيز عليك.

darija: bghit ga3 tlamd ystafdo men lkhibra dialk.
eng: I want all of the students to benefit from your expertise.
darija_ar: بغيت ڭاع تلامد يستافدو من لخيبرا ديالك.

darija: ma3ndi mandir bl aghani dial ddrari SSghar
eng: I'm not interested in child songs.

darija: ghadi ykon hadchi koumik o ghadi yjib lntibah dial tlamd lkhrin.
eng: It would be funny though and it would get other students to pay attention
darija_ar: غادي يكون هادشي كوميك أُ غادي يجيب لنتيباه ديال تلامد لخرين.

darija: Talaba flghalib kayn3so idan chi 7aja li ghadi tjbed lntibah dialhom hia li khaSSana.
eng: Often students fall asleep so something to grab their attention might be just the thing
darija_ar: طالابا فلغاليب كاينعسو إدان شي حاجا لي غادي تجبد لنتيباه ديالهوم هيا لي خاصّانا.

eng: I see you have a lot of mind.

darija: daba nchoufo wach ayb9a hakka flmti7an jjay!

darija_ar: دابا نشوفو واش أيبقا هاكّا فلمتيحان الجاي!

eng: I appreciate your advice, but I remind you that I'm the teacher, and you're the student.

darija: idan ana howa li kay3Ti nnasa2i7.

darija_ar: إدان أنا هووا لي كايعطي الناساإح.

eng: And now, I advise you to work hard and come next week with a report for your comrades.
darija_ar: أُ دابا, كانصّحك تخدم مزيان أُ تجي سيمانا جايّا ب راپّور ل زومالاء ديالك.

darija: nchoufouk men daba simana, ntmenna lkhdma dialk tkoun meziana!
eng: See you in a week, your job will have better be good!
darija_ar: نشوفوك من دابا سيمانا, نتمنّا لخدما ديالك تكون مزيانا!

darija: hadi ch7al men simana machefna b3Diyatna.
eng: It's been a few weeks since we've seen each other.

darija_ar: نتا درييف حيت كاتزورني مرّا مرّا

They can be much older than you.

darija: makanDench annaho mochkil dial l3mer, hadi ms2ala dial 39lia
eng: I don't think its an age thing, its an attitude of mind
darija_ar: ماكانضنش أنّاهو موشكيل ديال لعمر, هادي مسألا ديال عقليا

darija: ma3reftch 3lach chi nass charfin dima khasshom yngro o ytchekkaw bezzaf
eng: I don't know why some old people have to grumble and moan so much
darija_ar: ماعرفتش علاش شي ناسّ شارفين ديما خاسّهوم ينڭرو أُ يتشكّاو بزّاف

darija: walakin wach 3ndkom chi nachaTat li katkono fihom mjmo3in: la marsh, al3ab, moselsalat...?
eng: But do you guys have any activities where you're all together: Walk, board games, shows...?
darija_ar: والاكين واش عندكوم شي ناشاطات لي كاتكونو فيهوم مجموعين: لا مارسه, ألعاب, موسلسالات...?

darija: ghir 7it 7na kbar fl3mer makay3nich annaho mab9ach 3ndna daw9
eng: Just because we are old does not mean we have lost all sense of taste
darija_ar: غير حيت حنا كبار فلعمر ماكايعنيش أنّاهو مابقاش عندنا داوق

darija: iwa f had l7ala kantmenna annak tkhroj, wakha ghi bou7dek, tmechcha.
eng: I hope in this case you go out, even alone, take walks.
darija_ar: إوا ف هاد لحالا كانتمنّا أنّاك تخروج, واخا غي بوحدك, تمشّا.

darija: o kantmenna annak tkon mazal katl3b l guitar!
eng: And I hope you still play the guitar!
darija_ar: أُ كانتمنّا أنّاك تكون مازال كاتلعب ل ڭويتار!

darija: ydiya 9herhom romatizm man9derch ba9i nl3b l mossi9a walakin 7fidi kayji 3ndi merra merra o kayl3b lia lmossi9a
eng: My hands are a bit too arthritic now for making music but my grandson does visit and play for me sometimes
darija_ar: يدييا قهرهوم روماتيزم مانقدرش باقي نلعب ل موسّيقا والاكين حفيدي كايجي عندي مرّا مرّا أُ كايلعب ليا لموسّيقا

darija: nnass li kheddamin hna mziyrin makaykheliwch nnozala2 ykherjo bo7dhom
eng: The staff are very strict about allowing residents to go out on their own
darija_ar: الناسّ لي خدّامين هنا مزييرين ماكايخليوش النوزالاء يخرجو بوحدهوم

darija: kayhezzou lhem l se77a o ssalama; ila Ta7 chi wa7d 2ila akhirih mn b3d aykhaShom y3mro bezzaf dial lwra9
eng: they worry about health and safety; falls etc and then having to fill in lots of paperwork I guess
darija_ar: كايهزّو لهم ل سحّا أُ السالاما; إلا طاح شي واحد إلا أخيريه من بعد أيخاصهوم يعمرو بزّاف ديال لوراق

eng: That's very nice of your grandson.
darija_ar: هادشي زين بزّاف اللي دار حفيدك.

darija: wakha nass lli kheddamin hna mziyrin, 3la 9bel sikiriti, katb9a 3ala9tek m3ahom meziana?
eng: Even if the staff is strict, for security reasons, you still get along well with them?
darija_ar: واخا ناسّ اللي خدّامين هنا مزييرين, علا قبل سيكيريتي, كاتبقا عالاقتك معاهوم مزيانا?

eng: they are fine and I make them laugh

darija: 3refti 3ndi wa7d rou7 dou3aba fchkel, ma3reftch wach dima kayfehmouni

darija_ar: عرفتي عندي واحد روح دوعابا فشكل, ماعرفتش واش ديما كايفهموني

darija_ar: إلا كنتي كاضحّخوم, هادي عالاما مزيانا.

darija: n9der njib lik chi kookizat ila bghiti!
eng: I can bring you some cookies if you want!
darija_ar: نقدر نجيب ليك شي كوكيزات إلا بغيتي!

eng: Oooh I love cookies, yes please.

darija: kanDen anna Tebbakha kayban liha kolchi imma mrekkeb lfom imma ma3ndoch ssnan ga3
eng: I thik the cook thinks everybody has dodgy false teeth or even no teeth at all
darija_ar: كانضن أنّا طبّاخا كايبان ليها كولشي إمّا مركّب لفوم إمّا ماعندوش السنان ڭاع

darija: lmohim, makhaSch ykon hadchi khayb tal had daraja.
eng: Well, it doesn't have to be too bad.
darija_ar: لموهيم, ماخاصش يكون هادشي خايب تال هاد داراجا.

darija: kayna wa7d resTora 9riba, ymken lik tmchi liha merra merra, wakha lpersonel makaybghich ykhrj.
eng: There's a restaurant nearby, you could go from time to time, even if the staff doesn't like to go out.
darija_ar: كاينا واحد رسطورا قريبا, يمكن ليك تمشي ليها مرّا مرّا, واخا لپرسونل ماكايبغيش يخرج.

eng: What a surprise to see you.

darija: wach knti ghir dayz men hna wla jiti khoSoSan bach tchoufni?
eng: Were you passing by or have you made a special trip to see me?
darija_ar: واش كنتي غير دايز من هنا ولا جيتي خوصوصان باش تشوفني?

eng: It's been over a month since we met.

darija: Tbib dowz lia dik simana o galia rani S7i7 fSi7.
eng: The doctor gave me a check-up last week and said I was as fit as a fiddle.
darija_ar: طبيب دووز ليا ديك سيمانا أُ ڭاليا راني صحيح فصيح.

darija: meziana b nisba l chi wa7d f3mro khmsa o tmanin 3am.
eng: Not bad for someone eighty five years old.
darija_ar: مزيانا ب نيسبا ل شي واحد فعمرو خمسا أُ تمانين عام.

darija: yallah tgheddit walakin wach bghitini ngoul l chi wa7d yjib lik chi kwiyess dial atay wla l9hwa?
eng: I've just had my lunch but would you like me to ask someone to get a cup of tea or coffee for you?
darija_ar: يالّاه تغدّيت والاكين واش بغيتيني نڭول ل شي واحد يجيب ليك شي كوييسّ ديال أتاي ولا لقهوا?

eng: It makes me happy to know your health is good.
darija_ar: فرحت فاش عرفت أنّا صحتك مزيانا.

eng: Yes, I'll have a cup of coffee.

darija: ghadi nde9 ljaras bach yji chi wa7d yjib lik l9hwa.
eng: I'll ring the bell to get someone to get you a coffee.
darija_ar: غادي ندق لجاراس باش يجي شي واحد يجيب ليك لقهوا.

darija: flowl makentch baghi nkhrj men dari l9dima o nji lhna, walakin welleft daba.
eng: I was apprehensive about moving here from my old house, but I have settled in now.
darija_ar: فلوول ماكنتش باغي نخرج من داري لقديما أُ نجي لهنا, والاكين ولّفت دابا.

darija: makanch ymken nb9a bo7di f ddar o n9abl rassi
eng: There is no way that I could have stayed any longer at home and looked after myself
darija_ar: ماكانش يمكن نبقا بوحدي ف الدار أُ نقابل راسّي

darija: lmakla men jiha khra machi chi 7aja.
eng: The food though is not very good.
darija_ar: لماكلا من جيها خرا ماشي شي حاجا.

eng: Yeah, that's what I remember about food.
darija_ar: أيه, هادشي لي بقيت عاقل عليه علا لماكلا.

eng: Do you go out once in a while?

darija: kantmenna anna had dar l3ajaza fiha anshiTa mokhtalifa.
eng: I hope the retirement home is about various activities.
darija_ar: كانتمنّا أنّا هاد دار لعاجازا فيها أنسهيطا موختاليفا.

eng: I go out once a week.

darija: kayjibo lina mini-bus kayddina l chi blassa meziana.
eng: They arrange a mini-bus which takes us somewhere interesting.
darija_ar: كايجيبو لينا ميني-بوس كايدّينا ل شي بلاسّا مزيانا.

darija: dik simana mchina l l9el3a dial Windsor
eng: last week we had a trip to Windsor Castle.
darija_ar: ديك سيمانا مشينا ل لقلعا ديال ويندسور

darija: ymken nl3b bl kora m3a nass khrin hna wla ymken nmchi l doross dial chi3r.
eng: I can throw a ball to other people here or I can go to poetry classes.
darija_ar: يمكن نلعب بل كورا معا ناسّ خرين هنا ولا يمكن نمشي ل دوروسّ ديال شيعر.

eng: You still playing the piano, I hope?

darija: o merra fch7al kayji chi wa7d ydir lina chi spectacle.
eng: And once in a while someone comes in to entertain us.
darija_ar: أُ مرّا فشحال كايجي شي واحد يدير لينا شي سپكتاكل.

darija: ana bikhir o kantmenna nkon chad f rassi b7alk fach tkon 3ndi 85 3am!
eng: I'm fine and hoping to be as alert as you at 85 years old!
darija_ar: أنا بيخير أُ كانتمنّا نكون شاد ف راسّي بحالك فاش تكون عندي 85 عام!

eng: I hope you can come again.
My best wishes to your family
I'm so glad to be home

darija: mchit l wa7d dar l3ajaza bach nchouf wa7d sa7bi 9dim o ndir rassi rah 3ziz 3lia, ghi bach n7awl nakhd flousso fl waSSia
eng: I had to go to this retirement home and see an old friend and pretend to be in love with him, just to try and get his money in his will
darija_ar: مشيت ل واحد دار لعاجازا باش نشوف واحد ساحبي قديم أُ ندير راسّي راه عزيز عليا, غي باش نحاول ناخد فلوسّو فل واصّيا

eng: He is on his last legs you see
And we so badly need the money

darija: walakin kant ri7a dial cherraf 3aTia temma - hamdollah rj3t l ddar
eng: But it smelt so badly of old people there - I'm glad to be home
darija_ar: والاكين كانت ريحا ديال شرّاف عاطيا تمّا - هامدولّاه رجعت ل الدار

eng: How was your day, sweet one?

darija: wach sa7b bbak l9dim, dak lmota7arrish li kayb9a ychouf fl bnat b douk l3inin lkbar dialo?
eng: Was it your dad's old friend, the kind of pervert who looks at all the girls with his fat-ass eyes?
darija_ar: واش ساحب الباك لقديم, داك لموتاحارّيسه لي كايبقا يشوف فل بنات ب دوك لعينين لكبار ديالو?

darija: kant wa7d lbnia sghira smitha Anya makennach kantkheliwha bou7dha
eng: There was a poor girl there called Anya who we wouldn't leave alone
darija_ar: كانت واحد لبنيا سغيرا سميتها أنيا ماكنّاش كانتخليوها بوحدها

darija: 39elt 3lih, o beSSa7 kan dima kaydir fik chi choufat fchkel.
eng: I remember him, and it's true that he was always looking at you in a very inappropriate way.
darija_ar: عقلت عليه, أُ بصّاح كان ديما كايدير فيك شي شوفات فشكل.

darija: bent sghira kheddama f dar l3ajaza?
eng: A young girl who works at the nursing home?
darija_ar: بنت سغيرا خدّاما ف دار لعاجازا?

darija: msikina, douwz 7yatha wsT chchorraf, m7roumin o cherraf.
eng: Poor thing, spending her life in the middle of old, frustrated and old.
darija_ar: مسيكينا, دووز حياتها وسط الشورّاف, محرومين أُ شرّاف.

darija: howa mreffe7 bejjehd, dima kent kangoul anched chi 7aja fach aymout.
eng: He is so rich, I always thought I would get something out of it when he passed away.
darija_ar: هووا مرفّح بجّهد, ديما كنت كانڭول أنشد شي حاجا فاش أيموت.

darija: walakin daba hadik Anya katban lia hia lli wellat batched had lblaSSSa
eng: But now this Anya seems to be getting in there instead
darija_ar: والاكين دابا هاديك أنيا كاتبان ليا هيا اللي ولّات باتشد هاد لبلاصّصا

darija: makatb9ach fia had Anya, ghadi ykheli liha bezzaf dial lflouss tkhiyel
eng: I don't feel that sorry for Anya, he will leave her lots of money I imagine
darija_ar: ماكاتبقاش فيا هاد أنيا, غادي يخلي ليها بزّاف ديال لفلوسّ تخييل

eng: In a way, she's gonna deserve it.

darija: walakin rah ma3ndnach bezzaf dial lflouss had liyamat.
eng: But we really don't have much money these days.
darija_ar: والاكين راه ماعندناش بزّاف ديال لفلوسّ هاد لييامات.

darija: 3reft, walakin chkon moul lfalTa f hadchi?
eng: I know, but who's fault is that?
darija_ar: عرفت, والاكين شكون مول لفالطا ف هادشي?

eng: You do like to gamble and drink a lot
darija_ar: عزيز عليك تقمّر أُ تشرب بزّاف

eng: Yes, those are my little pleasures.

darija: walakin 3ziz 3lik chi kwiysat dial l vin dial fransa tchrbhom.
eng: But you also like a few glasses of good French wine for drinks.
darija_ar: والاكين عزيز عليك شي كوييسات ديال ل ڤين ديال فرانسا تشربهوم.

darija: khaSni n9lbo 3la had Anya, o nwerrih annaha baghia ghi flousso
eng: I need to turn him against Anya, and show him what a money-grabber she is
darija_ar: خاصني نقلبو علا هاد أنيا, أُ نورّيه أنّاها باغيا غي فلوسّو

darija: kayban lia nmchi n3iyet lih daba o nbda nzr3 lih had lfikra f rasso
eng: I might go call him now and start planting the seed of that idea
darija_ar: كايبان ليا نمشي نعييت ليه دابا أُ نبدا نزرع ليه هاد لفيكرا ف راسّو

eng: Soon, we will not be poor anymore!
In the meantime, shall we open a bottle?
darija_ar: ب هاد لموناسّابا, نحلّو شي قريعا?

darija: Oh sir 3ellah, kayban lia kansta79oha, kan lyouma s3ib
eng: Oh go on then, we do deserve it I suppose, it's been such a hard day
darija_ar: أُه سير علّاه, كايبان ليا كانستاحقوها, كان ليوما سعيب

eng: Good evening, how was your day?

darija: daz ki lwil... Sebbat 3lia chta f Tri9 lkhdma, o makan 3ndi bach nechchef 7wayji, iwa o b9it kandour nhar kaml b 7wayji fazguine.
eng: Rubbish... I got soaked on the way to work, and then there was no way to dry my stuff, so I've been walking around in damp clothes all day.
darija_ar: داز كي لويل... صبّات عليا شتا ف طريق لخدما, أُ ماكان عندي باش نشّف حوايجي, إوا أُ بقيت كاندور نهار كامل ب حوايجي فازڭوين.

darija: bghit ghir nDreb chi tdwicha skhouna o nchreb chi kwiyess dial atay.
eng: I just want to take a long hot shower and have a cup of tea.
darija_ar: بغيت غير نضرب شي تدويشا سخونا أُ نشرب شي كوييسّ ديال أتاي.

darija: llah 3la 7bibti mskina, b9at fazga nhar kaml, 3ellah maykounch Drbek lberd.
eng: My poor baby, he was all wet all day long, I hope you didn't catch cold.
darija_ar: اللاه علا حبيبتي مسكينا, بقات فازڭا نهار كامل, علّاه مايكونش ضربك لبرد.

eng: I told you to dress up.

darija: l mini jupe o sebbaT dial SSif, f chher 4, rah katghamri o Safi.
eng: The mini-skirt and the summer shoes, in April and in a long time, it's a risk.
darija_ar: ل ميني جوپ أُ سبّاط ديال الصيف, ف شهر 4, راه كاتغامري أُ صافي.

darija: ghi matgoulch lia biti tferrej fl kora o tsekhkhen chi pizza mjemmda, ymken lik tb9a ch7al ma bghiti f douche o tchreb atay.
eng: As long as you're not asking me to watch football and warm up a frozen pizza, you can stay as long as you want in the shower and drink your tea.
darija_ar: غي ماتڭولش ليا بيتي تفرّج فل كورا أُ تسخّن شي پيزّا مجمّدا, يمكن ليك تبقا شحال ما بغيتي ف دوش أُ تشرب أتاي.

darija: beSSa7, walakin rah mori7in, o fach khrejt men ddar kant chemch!
eng: Yeah, but they're so comfortable, and when I left the house the sun way shining!
darija_ar: بصّاح, والاكين راه موريحين, أُ فاش خرجت من الدار كانت شمش!

darija: Ouf... kantmenna kon dowzt nhar ghi f ddar m3a lkelb...
eng: Ouf... I wish I could have spent the day at home with the dog...
darija_ar: وف... كانتمنّا كون دووزت نهار غي ف الدار معا لكلب...

darija: b3da howa kaywenessni 7sen men hadok li f lkhdma.
eng: He makes far better company than the people at work.
darija_ar: بعدا هووا كايونسّني حسن من هادوك لي ف لخدما.

darija: 3refti ma3ndich m3a kora o pizza mjemmda... 7sen lia n commandi lmakla dial lhnoud,
eng: You know I can't stand the football, and frozen pizza... I'd rather order in Indian food
darija_ar: عرفتي ماعنديش معا كورا أُ پيزّا مجمّدا... حسن ليا ن كومّاندي لماكلا ديال لهنود,

darija: ghadi tcommandiha fach nkon kandowech... ana bghit dakchi li mwalfa kannakhd.
eng: Will you order it while I'm in the shower... I'll have my usual.
darija_ar: غادي تكومّانديها فاش نكون كاندووش... أنا بغيت داكشي لي موالفا كانّاخد.

darija: meli mazal fazg, staghl lforSa o kherrej lkelb, ana ansekhkhen lik l7emmam o ncomandi lmakla dial lhnoud.
eng: Since you're all wet, take the time to get the dog out, I'll run you a bath and order Indian.
darija_ar: ملي مازال فازڭ, ستاغل لفورصا أُ خرّج لكلب, أنا أنسخّن ليك لحمّام أُ نكوماندي لماكلا ديال لهنود.

darija: wakha, maymkench tzid tkeffess 3lia l9adia kter men hakka, o mamezianch lkelb yb9a f ddar nhar kaml!
eng: Ok, it can't really make it any worse than it already is, and it's not good for him to be inside all day!
darija_ar: واخا, مايمكنش تزيد تكفّسّ عليا لقاديا كتر من هاكّا, أُ مامزيانش لكلب يبقا ف الدار نهار كامل!

darija: wach men niytek, hada rah kelb dial ddar, fach bghit nkherjo f chta mabghach, o bal lia ghir fl9ent, o b9a kayjerr f sensla dialo bach yrj3 l ddar.
eng: You're kidding, he's an apartment dog, when I tried to get him out in the rain, he just wouldn't come out, he just peed on the corner, and he was already shooting on his leash to get home.
darija_ar: واش من نييتك, هادا راه كلب ديال الدار, فاش بغيت نخرجو ف شتا مابغاش, أُ بال ليا غير فلقنت, أُ بقا كايجرّ ف سنسلا ديالو باش يرجع ل الدار.

eng: He didn't used to be, you've spoiled him way too much!

darija: khasso ywellef ljow lkhayb, rah nawyin nre7lo l Swira aSlan!
eng: He needs to get used to bad weather, we are planning to move to Essaouira after all!
darija_ar: خاسّو يولّف لجوو لخايب, راه ناويين نرحلو ل صويرا أصلان!

darija: lla, nta nawi tr7el l Merrakch.
eng: Not at all, you plan to move to Marrakech.
darija_ar: اللا, نتا ناوي ترحل ل مرّاكش.

darija: 3ndi chekhSiya morhafa o hchicha, b7al lkliyeb diali.
eng: I'm a sensitive and fragile character, just like my little dog.
darija_ar: عندي شخصييا مورهافا أُ هشيشا, بحال لكلييب ديالي.

darija: f jami3 l7alat ljow f merrakch zine.
eng: In any case the weather in Marrakech is wonderful.
darija_ar: ف جاميع لحالات لجوو ف مرّاكش زين.

eng: Ok, I'm going to head out with the dog!
Is that a small orange juice?
darija_ar: واش هادا عاصير ديال ليمون سغير?

eng: And would you like ice in it?
How would you like your coffee?

darija: bghit chi kass kbir dial limoun m3Sor, bla telj.
eng: More like a big glass of squeezed orange juice, no ice.
darija_ar: بغيت شي كاسّ كبير ديال ليمون معصور, بلا تلج.

eng: Yes I can do that for you.

darija: ghadi ykhSni da9i9a bach n3Sr lik llimoun.
eng: It will take a minute to squeeze the orange juice.
darija_ar: غادي يخصني داقيقا باش نعصر ليك الليمون.

eng: It's a white coffee, because I've never tasted it.
darija_ar: هادي قهوا بيضا, حيت ماعمرني دقتها.

eng: It's very good - the best in town!

darija: ghadi nsayb lik chwia o tchouf achno ban lik.
eng: I'll make you some and you can see what you think.
darija_ar: غادي نسايب ليك شويا أُ تشوف أشنو بان ليك.

darija: ayeh, ana ghi dayz men had lmdina 3la 9bel chi jtima3 dial lkhdma.
eng: Yes, I'm just passing through this town for a work meeting.
darija_ar: أيه, أنا غي دايز من هاد لمدينا علا قبل شي جتيماع ديال لخدما.

darija: 3ndhom wa7d l3arD khaSS daba 3la Vincent Van Gogh.
eng: They have a special exihibition at the moment on Vincent Van Gogh.
darija_ar: عندهوم واحد لعارض خاصّ دابا علا ڤينسنت ڤان ڭوغ.

eng: Or you could visit the cathedral.
Where the art and the cathedral are located.

darija: lm3riD b3id b miyat mitro 3la l9hwa.
eng: The art gallery is just a hundred metres from the cafe.
darija_ar: لمعريض بعيد ب مييات ميترو علا لقهوا.

eng: Turn left and you will find it.
darija_ar: ضور علا ليصر أُ غادي تلقاه.

eng: The cathedral is a bit further.
What do you put in it?
Can I get you something else instead?
darija_ar: بغيتي نجيب شي حاجا خرا بلاصتها?

darija: wach 3ndkom chi wSfat khaSSin w7din khrin hna?
eng: Do you have any other special recipes here?
darija_ar: واش عندكوم شي وصفات خاصّين وحدين خرين هنا?

darija: men ghir hadchi, bghit chwia dial skar o chi ppay l 3aSir dial limoun.
eng: Otherwise, I'd like a little sugar and a straw for my orange juice.
darija_ar: من غير هادشي, بغيت شويا ديال سكار أُ شي الپاي ل عاصير ديال ليمون.

darija: makayn ta wSfa khaSSa khra. ghir l9hwa b style dial ngliz.
eng: No other special recipes. Only coffee English style.
darija_ar: ماكاين تا وصفا خاصّا خرا. غير لقهوا ب ستيل ديال نڭليز.

darija: tbghi tguless f chi Tbla o njib lik l3aSir dial limoun?
eng: Would you like to sit at a table and i will bring your orange juice over to you?
darija_ar: تبغي تڭولسّ ف شي طبلا أُ نجيب ليك لعاصير ديال ليمون?

darija: Safi dakchi li ghadi ndir o men b3d ghadi ykhSni nmchi nserbi l klian li yallah ja daba.
eng: Right I'll do that and then I need to serve the customer who has just come in.
darija_ar: صافي داكشي لي غادي ندير أُ من بعد غادي يخصني نمشي نسربي ل كليان لي يالّاه جا دابا.

darija: ntmenna y3jbek l3aSir dial limoun o tmchi tchouf lm3riD lfenni.
eng: I hope you enjoy the orange juice and get to see the art gallery.
darija_ar: نتمنّا يعجبك لعاصير ديال ليمون أُ تمشي تشوف لمعريض لفنّي.

eng: Hello my dear, it's been a while!
Oh, how nice of you to come to me!
darija_ar: أُه, شوكران بزّاف حيت جيتي عندي!

eng: It's true, it's been a long time.
I don't feel so great though sadly.

darija: mab9itch chab kif kent ch7al hada
eng: I am not as young as I used to be
darija_ar: مابقيتش شاب كيف كنت شحال هادا

eng: I feel like I'm starting to fall apart a bit
Do you know what I mean?
Oh, yes, I can see that.

darija: ymken lik t77ouwel hna, l had dar l3ajaza, wla lla?
eng: You could move in here, in that retirement home, wouldn't you?
darija_ar: يمكن ليك تحّوول هنا, ل هاد دار لعاجازا, ولا اللا?

darija: kaynin bezzaf dial l anshiTa, o nnass li kheddamin hna driyfine.
eng: There's plenty of activities, and the staff is very nice.
darija_ar: كاينين بزّاف ديال ل أنسهيطا, أُ الناسّ لي خدّامين هنا درييفين.
خوصوصان أمينا, هيا لي عزيزا عليا.

darija: ayeeh, tla9it m3a Amina fach kent jay, katban llah y3emmerha dar
eng: Oh yes, I met Amina on my way in, she did seem very nice
darija_ar: أييه, تلاقيت معا أمينا فاش كنت جاي, كاتبان اللاه يعمّرها دار

eng: Maybe I should look into it
I still like having my independence though

darija: o wldi jjilali mazal kay3awenni b jehdo kaml
eng: And my son Jilali still helps out as much as he can
darija_ar: أُ ولدي الجيلالي مازال كايعاونّي ب جهدو كامل

darija: b Tabi3t l7al, rani mazal chad f rassi!
eng: Of course, I still have my head, you know!
darija_ar: ب طابيعت لحال, راني مازال شاد ف راسّي!

darija: walakin aykon kaydi lih lw9t bezzaf, bach y9ablek.
eng: But it must take him some time, to take care of you.
darija_ar: والاكين أيكون كايدي ليه لوقت بزّاف, باش يقابلك.

darija: o hna, kayn ga3 dakchi li m7taj!
eng: And here, there's everything you need!
darija_ar: أُ هنا, كاين ڭاع داكشي لي محتاج!

darija: katferej fl aflam, katchark fl al3ab, o kayna mktaba...
eng: You see movies, you participate in games, there's a library...
darija_ar: كاتفرج فل أفلام, كاتشارك فل ألعاب, أُ كاينا مكتابا...

darija: walakin rak 3arfni, kantcherreT bezzaf fl makla!
eng: But you know me, I'm demanding on the kitchen!
darija_ar: والاكين راك عارفني, كانتشرّط بزّاف فل ماكلا!

darija: achnahia l makla lmofeDala dialk li kaySaybo?
eng: What is your favourite meal that they make?
darija_ar: أشناهيا ل ماكلا لموفضالا ديالك لي كايصايبو?

darija: wla khaSni ngoul lli katfreD 3lihom ySaybo lik!
eng: Or should I say that you make them make!
darija_ar: ولا خاصني نڭول اللي كاتفرض عليهوم يصايبو ليك!

eng: Chicken Tajine with potato and olives.

darija: S3ib Tiyeb djaj, khoSoSan ila kenti kaTiyeb kimmia ktira l bezzaf dial nass, walakin hna, TTebakh kayt9en chghlo!
eng: It's hard to cook the chiken, especially when you make a lot of people for a lot of people, but here, the cook can do very well!
darija_ar: صعيب طييب دجاج, خوصوصان إلا كنتي كاطييب كيمّيا كتيرا ل بزّاف ديال ناسّ, والاكين هنا, الطباخ كايتقن شغلو!

darija: Oh hadchi kayferre7, o mberre3 b nisba l dar l3ajaza
eng: Oh that does sound good, and quite fancy for a retirement home
darija_ar: أُه هادشي كايفرّح, أُ مبرّع ب نيسبا ل دار لعاجازا

darija: kan kay7sab lia wach ghadi y3Tiwna ghir Sobba o lkhobz 9as7!
eng: I had thought it would all be bowls of watery soup and dry crackers!
darija_ar: كان كايحساب ليا واش غادي يعطيونا غير صوبّا أُ لخوبز قاسح!

darija: o rak 3arf ch7al 3ziza 3lia zzebda o lformaj o lmakla lbnina
eng: And you know how much I like butter and cheese and tasty foods
darija_ar: أُ راك عارف شحال عزيزا عليا الزبدا أُ لفورماج أُ لماكلا لبنينا

darija: jari kamal kayakkol ghir Sobba, hadi kayna.
eng: My neighbor Kamal only eats bowls of soup, that's true.
darija_ar: جاري كامال كاياكّول غير صوبّا, هادي كاينا.

eng: But that's because he has no teeth, the poor old.
darija_ar: والاكين راه حيت ماعندو سنان, مسكين.

eng: I've got almost all my teeth, I'm lucky!
darija_ar: مازال عندي سناني كاملين تقريبان, هامدولّاه!

darija: bghiti tmchi l Salon ncherbo chi kass dial atay?
eng: Do you want to go to the living room for a cup of tea?
darija_ar: بغيتي تمشي ل صالون نشربو شي كاسّ ديال أتاي?

eng: I have always admired your full set of teeth

darija_ar: أُ من لفوق, عندهوم كيكات لداد.

darija: kan9Sd, ila chefna ch7al kankheleS kolla chher, hamdollah annahom fabor.
eng: I mean, given what it costs me every month, luckily it's free.
darija_ar: كانقصد, إلا شفنا شحال كانخلص كولّا شهر, هامدولّاه أنّاهوم فابور.

eng: As soon as I get up, let's go!

darija: ymken n3iyet 3la Amina bach tjib lkorsi
eng: I can give Amina a shout to get the chair
darija_ar: يمكن نعييت علا أمينا باش تجيب لكورسي

darija: chi 15 l da9i9a hadi bach cheftha, twe7echtha!
eng: It's been 15 minutes since I've seen her, I miss her!
darija_ar: شي 15 ل داقيقا هادي باش شفتها, توحشتها!

eng: Oh wow you really do like Amina a lot!
darija_ar: أُه ووو عزيزا عليك هاد أمينا بزّاف!

eng: I think she might be a bit too young for you
I'm allowed to dream, don't I?

darija: o men fog hadchi kan kay7sab lia wach katbghini f ssir...
eng: Plus I thought you had secretly always loved me...
darija_ar: أُ من فوڭ هادشي كان كايحساب ليا واش كاتبغيني ف السير...

darija: rah kenti dima 7aDra, f 5 dial tjwijat diali lli maSd9ouch
eng: You have always been there, through my 5 previous failed marriages
darija_ar: راه كنتي ديما حاضرا, ف 5 ديال تجويجات ديالي اللي ماصدقوش

darija: kenti dima 7adra bach t9aDDi l omor
eng: You were always there to pick up the pieces
darija_ar: كنتي ديما حادرا باش تقاضّي ل أُمور

darija: dima kent kangoul rah ghadi ykon lw9t kter
eng: I always thought there would be more time
darija_ar: ديما كنت كانڭول راه غادي يكون لوقت كتر

darija: o ghadi yji w9tna fach kenna mazal sghar bach ntber3o bih
eng: And that our time together would come when we were still young enough to enjoy it
darija_ar: أُ غادي يجي وقتنا فاش كنّا مازال سغار باش نتبرعو بيه

darija: dima kant katjini lfikra dial ncherfo bjouj romansia
eng: I always thought the idea of growing old together sounded romantic
darija_ar: ديما كانت كاتجيني لفيكرا ديال نشرفو بجوج رومانسيا

darija: walakin l7a9i9a a9al romansia - fiha tsmak, nesyan, o Sda3 o l alam.
eng: But the reality is bit less romantic - it's mostly deafness, forgetfulness, and aches and pains.
darija_ar: والاكين لحاقيقا أقال رومانسيا - فيها تسماك, نسيان, أُ صداع أُ ل ألام.

darija: walakin atkon zina annak t3ich hadchi m3a chi chakhS aakhar
eng: But it would be nice to do experience those things with someone else
darija_ar: والاكين أتكون زينا أنّاك تعيش هادشي معا شي شاخص اخار

darija: wach ghadi t3rD 3la bezzaf dial nnass?
eng: Are you going to invite a lot of people?
darija_ar: واش غادي تعرض علا بزّاف ديال الناسّ?

darija: lmohim, l9aDia hia, ch7al ma kano nnass ktar, ch7al mma atkon lkika 9lila 3ndna!
eng: Well, the thing is, the more people there are, the less cake there'll be for us!
darija_ar: لموهيم, لقاضيا هيا, شحال ما كانو الناسّ كتار, شحال الما أتكون لكيكا قليلا عندنا!

eng: That's not a very religious idea!

darija: ma3ada ila guelna lihom yjibo chwia m3ahom.
eng: Unless we ask them to bring some with them.
darija_ar: ماعادا إلا ڭولنا ليهوم يجيبو شويا معاهوم.

darija: 3reft walakin hadi l7efla diali idan ana lli ghadi n9errer!
eng: I know but it's my party so I decide!
darija_ar: عرفت والاكين هادي لحفلا ديالي إدان أنا اللي غادي نقرّر!

darija: ayeh, t9der takol l7lwa kamla bou7dek fl 9niyet dialk!
eng: Yeah, you could eat a cake all by yourself in your corner!
darija_ar: أيه, تقدر تاكول لحلوا كاملا بوحدك فل قنييت ديالك!

eng: Oh no, that's not very fun!

darija: khaSSk t3rD 3la bezzaf dial nass o tsayb bezzaf dial l7lwa bach tkon bikhir.
eng: You have to invite a lot of people and prepare a lot of cake for the party to be good.
darija_ar: خاصّك تعرض علا بزّاف ديال ناسّ أُ تسايب بزّاف ديال لحلوا باش تكون بيخير.

eng: By the way, I hope you didn't invite Rachid.
darija_ar: فكّرتيني, كانتمنّا ماتكونش عرضتي علا راشيد.

darija: ma3ndich bezzaf dial l aSdi9a2 men ghir Rachid...
eng: I don't have many friends except Rachid...
darija_ar: ماعنديش بزّاف ديال ل أصديقاء من غير راشيد...

darija: hani kan3lmek, imma Rachid imma ana.
eng: I'm warning you, it's Rachid or me.
darija_ar: هاني كانعلمك, إمّا راشيد إمّا أنا.

darija: wakha wakha... dir nta ga3 lla2i7a dial lm3roDin.
eng: Ok ok... then you can do the guest list.
darija_ar: واخا واخا... دير نتا ڭاع اللاإحا ديال لمعروضين.

eng: I thought I'd invite Rachida, you know her.

darija: walakin ghir ila makantch atjib m3aha lkelb dialha.
eng: But only if she doesn't bring her dog with her.
darija_ar: والاكين غير إلا ماكانتش أتجيب معاها لكلب ديالها.

eng: You know without her dog she won't come
darija_ar: راك عارف ماتقدرش تجي بلا كلبها

eng: Ok but it'll have to stay outside.
I don't want it messing up the new carpet!
We'll put it on the balcony, hopefully it'll jump!

darija: 3lah ma3ndkch l7ayawanat l alifa f ddar?
eng: Do you not have lots of pets at home?
darija_ar: علاه ماعندكش لحاياوانات ل أليفا ف الدار?

eng: You did say you liked rabbits, didn't you?
darija_ar: ڭولتي عزيز عليك قنيات, ولا اللا?

eng: I'll take the basket if it's full!
darija_ar: غادي ناخد السلّا إلا كانت عامرا!

darija: walakin mazal chwia dial lblaSSa l chi chwia dial ttout ila bghiti.
eng: But there's still some space for some more berries if you like.
darija_ar: والاكين مازال شويا ديال لبلاصّا ل شي شويا ديال التوت إلا بغيتي.

eng: With pleasure, I like berries very much.
But we should probably be heading back soon.

darija: khoSoSan 7it ma3ndnach khima lli ghadi t7mina
eng: Especially since we don't have a tent to shelter us
darija_ar: خوصوصان حيت ماعندناش خيما اللي غادي تحمينا

eng: And it's getting a little cold.

darija: dima kanjib m3aya bezzaf ma3rfti lw9t achno tjib.
eng: I always bring several with me just in case.
darija_ar: ديما كانجيب معايا بزّاف ماعرفتي لوقت أشنو تجيب.

eng: Ooh I even have some gloves!
darija_ar: وه أُ عندي حتا شي صبّاعات!

darija: mangoulikch lla 3la lfoular, 7it rah nit fia lberd.
eng: I'm not saying no for the scarf, because I'm really cold.
darija_ar: مانڭوليكش اللا علا لفولار, حيت راه نيت فيا لبرد.

darija: o men fo9 hadchi, Darbni lberd bezzaf, idan 7sen lia ngheTTi rassi.
eng: Besides, I have a big cold, so I'd better cover for myself.
darija_ar: أُ من فوق هادشي, ضاربني لبرد بزّاف, إدان حسن ليا نغطّي راسّي.

darija: ghadi nsekhen rassi bl foular dialk!
eng: I'll warm myself with your scarf!
darija_ar: غادي نسخن راسّي بل فولار ديالك!

eng: And I might even have some biscuits...

darija: walakin ymken bant lia chi Tirmos f llour dial ssella.
eng: But I think I see a Thermos in the back of the basket.
darija_ar: والاكين يمكن بانت ليا شي طيرموس ف اللور ديال السلّا.

darija: ndiro chi kwiyess dial atay nskhno bih!
eng: We can make a little tea to warm up!
darija_ar: نديرو شي كوييسّ ديال أتاي نسخنو بيه!

darija: o n9dro nzido chwia dial ttout bach nzido lmada9!
eng: And we could add some berries to give it some more flavour too!
darija_ar: أُ نقدرو نزيدو شويا ديال التوت باش نزيدو لماداق!

darija: o 9errert nmchi bou7di bach nbe33ed 3la kolchi.
eng: And I've decided to go all by myself to get away from it all.
darija_ar: أُ قرّرت نمشي بوحدي باش نبعّد علا كولشي.

darija: charika diali kayna f jouj blayS.
darija_ar: شاريكا ديالي كاينا ف جوج بلايص.

darija: hanta ghadi tchouf, lmenDer zwin fach ghadi nTl3o.
eng: You'll see, it's very nice once we're up here.
darija_ar: هانتا غادي تشوف, لمنضر زوين فاش غادي نطلعو.

darija: kankhaf nchouf men cherjem diali f TTb9a tania f ddar!
eng: I'm scared looking out of my second-floor window at home!
darija_ar: كانخاف نشوف من شرجم ديالي ف الطبقا تانيا ف الدار!

darija: ma3mrni 3jbni l3lou, o ghadi nTl3o lfo9 bezzaf!
eng: I've never liked heights, and we're going to be very high up!
darija_ar: ماعمرني عجبني لعلو, أُ غادي نطلعو لفوق بزّاف!

darija: s7ab, men lfo9, b7al chi b7er dial l9Ten.
eng: The clouds, from above, it's like a sea of cotton.
darija_ar: سحاب, من لفوق, بحال شي بحر ديال لقطن.

eng: And the light is absolutely splendid.

darija: ghadi yjiw o yjibo lmonaDa men daba chwia.
eng: They'll be stopping by with the soda soon.
darija_ar: غادي يجيو أُ يجيبو لموناضا من دابا شويا.

darija: khass takhd chi kass dial koka.
eng: You should ask for a glass of cola.
darija_ar: خاسّ تاخد شي كاسّ ديال كوكا.

eng: You wouldn't mind paying for me, would you?
darija_ar: ماشي موشكيل عندك تخلص عليا, ياك?

darija: maymkench lia nl9a bzTami b 3inia msdoudine...
eng: I can't really find my purse with my eyes closed...
darija_ar: مايمكنش ليا نلقا بزطامي ب عينيا مسدودين...

darija: ghadi nakhd la carte bancaire dialk o nkhelleS 3lina bjouj o 3la jarna ila ma3ndkch mochkil.
eng: I'm just gonna take your credit card and pay for both of us and our next-door neighbor if you don't mind.
darija_ar: غادي ناخد لا كارت بانكاير ديالك أُ نخلّص علينا بجوج أُ علا جارنا إلا ماعندكش موشكيل.

darija: achnahowa l code dial la carte bancaire dialk?
eng: What's the code for your credit card?
darija_ar: أشناهووا ل كود ديال لا كارت بانكاير ديالك?

darija: kayn wa7d sabab akhor 3lach makan7mlch nrkb f Tiyara!
eng: That's another reason I don't like flying!
darija_ar: كاين واحد ساباب أخور علاش ماكانحملش نركب ف طييارا!

darija: maymkench lik tti9 f nnass fl blayss lmsdoudin!
eng: You can never trust people in confined spaces!
darija_ar: مايمكنش ليك التيق ف الناسّ فل بلايسّ لمسدودين!

eng: But why do you talk to me?
I didn't have much choice, did I?

darija: walakin, ma7eddek hna, t9der tmchi tjib lia kass dial lma?
eng: But, whilst you're here, could you go get me a glass of water perhaps?
darija_ar: والاكين, ماحدّك هنا, تقدر تمشي تجيب ليا كاسّ ديال لما?

darija: o n9der nsa hadchi li yallah guelti 3la l carte bancaire diali.
eng: And I might just forget what you just said about my credit card.
darija_ar: أُ نقدر نسا هادشي لي يالّاه ڭولتي علا ل كارت بانكاير ديالي.

eng: I'll get the stewardess out here.

darija: ghadi tjib lik kass dial lma.
eng: She'll bring you a glass of water.
darija_ar: غادي تجيب ليك كاسّ ديال لما.

darija: o kayn dima aflam bach tbeddel ljow.
eng: And there's always movies to change your mind.
darija_ar: أُ كاين ديما أفلام باش تبدّل لجوو.

eng: It's been a while since we've been in the air.
darija_ar: شحال هادا أُ حنا ف سما.

darija: ghadi nkono temma men daba khmsa dial d9ay9.
eng: We'll be there in five minutes.
darija_ar: غادي نكونو تمّا من دابا خمسا ديال دقايق.

darija: rak 9rib tsali awal tsafira lik f TTiyara!
eng: You almost finished your first flight!
darija_ar: راك قريب تسالي أوال تسافيرا ليك ف الطييارا!

darija: o chokran 3la choklaT lli khdit lik men SSac fach makentich katchouf.
eng: And thank you for the chocolate I took out of your bag whilst you weren't looking.
darija_ar: أُ شوكران علا شوكلاط اللي خديت ليك من الصاك فاش ماكنتيش كاتشوف.

eng: You haven't eaten it, have you?

darija: kayban lia ghadi ykhSni ndeddel lblaSa...
eng: I think I'm gonna have to switch places...
darija_ar: كايبان ليا غادي يخصني نددّل لبلاصا...

darija: lil 2assaf kan 3ndi lkorsi li f l couloir.
eng: It's a shame I've got the aisle seat.
darija_ar: ليل أسّاف كان عندي لكورسي لي ف ل كولور.

eng: You finally split up with your boyfriend?
He was my husband, but my friend?

darija: 3refti, kan kay7sab lik makentch 3arfah ach kaydir howa o Maryam fach kano kaygoulo lia rah kayl3bo l hond...
eng: You know, he thought I didn't know what him and Maryam were doing when they said they were playing handball...
darija_ar: عرفتي, كان كايحساب ليك ماكنتش عارفاه أش كايدير هووا أُ ماريام فاش كانو كايڭولو ليا راه كايلعبو ل هوند...

darija: mazal chab, walakin hadchi makaychfe3ch lih 3la dik l anania dialo.
eng: He's young, but that doesn't excuse his selfishness.
darija_ar: مازال شاب, والاكين هادشي ماكايشفعش ليه علا ديك ل أنانيا ديالو.

darija: o aham men hadchi, had l3ala9a kant kaDDerek.
eng: And most importantly, this relationship was hurting you.
darija_ar: أُ أهام من هادشي, هاد لعالاقا كانت كاضّرك.

darija: walakin majawbtinich, kikat7essi daba, mora ma tfar9ti m3ah?
eng: But you didn't answer me, how do you feel now, after leaving him?
darija_ar: والاكين ماجاوبتينيش, كيكاتحسّي دابا, مورا ما تفارقتي معاه?

eng: As I said in the beginning: great!

darija: 3rfti, nta katsenneT lia 7sen menno howa... kanDen hadchi 3lach men dima nta 3ziz 3lia.
eng: You know, you listen to me more than he ever did... I think that's why I've always been so attached to you.
darija_ar: عرفتي, نتا كاتسنّط ليا حسن منّو هووا... كانضن هادشي علاش من ديما نتا عزيز عليا.

darija: 7di rask, ana ghir Tbib nfsani dialk!
eng: Be careful, I'm only your psychiatrist!
darija_ar: حدي راسك, أنا غير طبيب نفساني ديالك!

darija: achno kay7sab lik kat3rfi b DebT?
eng: What do you think you know exactly?
darija_ar: أشنو كايحساب ليك كاتعرفي ب ضبط?
أنا عارف أنّا هادشي ماشي بصّاح

eng: Why do you think I left him?

darija: kan hadchi bach nkono m3a b3Diyatna
eng: It was so that we could be together.
darija_ar: كان هادشي باش نكونو معا بعضيياتنا

darija: wach ghadi dir rask annak makentich kaddir dakchi li kenti kaddir had tlt snin li doweztha m3ak f l3ilaj?
eng: Are you going to pretend that you haven't been doing what you've been doing these past three years that I've been in therapy with you?
darija_ar: واش غادي دير راسك أنّاك ماكنتيش كادّير داكشي لي كنتي كادّير هاد تلت سنين لي دووزتها معاك ف لعيلاج?

eng: You're putting me in a difficult position.

darija: fach kantSenneT lik o kanhder m3ak, rah 3la 9bel attawazon annafsi dialk, 7it hadi khdmti.
eng: When I listen to you and I talk to you, it's for your psychological balance, because it's my job.
darija_ar: فاش كانتصنّط ليك أُ كانهدر معاك, راه علا قبل أتّاوازون أنّافسي ديالك, حيت هادي خدمتي.

darija: wach kenti katl3b bia had lw9t kaml?
eng: Have you just been playing with me all this time?
darija_ar: واش كنتي كاتلعب بيا هاد لوقت كامل?

darija: katmettel annak baghi t3rf kidaz nhari, ki kan7ess, 3layach kan9elleb f l7ayat?
eng: PRETENDING to want to know how my day was, how I felt, what I was looking for in life?
darija_ar: كاتمتّل أنّاك باغي تعرف كيداز نهاري, كي كانحسّ, علاياش كانقلّب ف لحايات?

darija: machi kanl3b, rah hakka kaykon l3ilaj annafsi.
eng: It's not a game, that's how therapy happens.
darija_ar: ماشي كانلعب, راه هاكّا كايكون لعيلاج أنّافسي.

darija: sm3i, kanDen annaho khaSS tfekri achno bghiti men 3nd Tbib nefsi dialk.
eng: Look, I think you should think about what you want from your psychiatrist.
darija_ar: سمعي, كانضن أنّاهو خاصّ تفكري أشنو بغيتي من عند طبيب نفسي ديالك.

darija: ymken khaSSk tmchi t3alji 3nd chi Tbib nefsi akhor.
eng: Maybe you should go to therapy with another psychiatrist.
darija_ar: يمكن خاصّك تمشي تعالجي عند شي طبيب نفسي أخور.

darija: 7it kan7ess, anna f dmaghk, l omor mkhtalfa 3la kifach khaSSha tkon bach ykhdm had l3ilaj.
eng: Because now I feel, in your mind, things are different from what they should be to make this happen.
darija_ar: حيت كانحسّ, أنّا ف دماغك, ل أُمور مختالفا علا كيفاش خاصّها تكون باش يخدم هاد لعيلاج.

darija: Hah-- rah kanmchi 3nd wa7d Tbib nfsi akhor!
darija_ar: هاه-- راه كانمشي عند واحد طبيب نفسي أخور!

darija: kay7sab lik rask dki... katl3b bia had lmodda kamla... kan kerhek...
eng: You think you're so smart... playing with me all this time... I HATE you...
darija_ar: كايحساب ليك راسك دكي... كاتلعب بيا هاد لمودّا كاملا... كان كرهك...

darija: kayban lia nsaliw had lli9a2 daba.
eng: I think we're going to end this meeting now.
darija_ar: كايبان ليا نساليو هاد الليقاء دابا.

darija: bl monasaba, ja lw9t dial lmriD jjay diali.
eng: By the way, it's time for my next patient.
darija_ar: بل موناسابا, جا لوقت ديال لمريض الجاي ديالي.

eng: No not all, it looks very creepy!

darija: lla ma3ndi la bawSala la khariTa.
eng: No I dont have a compass or a map.
darija_ar: اللا ماعندي لا باوصالا لا خاريطا.

eng: I could try my phone - but there is no reception.
Let's try going back the way we came
I thought you were taking the compass...
darija_ar: حساب ليا راه خديتي معاك لباوصالا...

eng: It's got GPS, it doesn't need a connection.

darija: lla, guelti ghadi takhd m3ak lbawSala.
eng: No, you said you were taking the compass.
darija_ar: اللا, ڭولتي غادي تاخد معاك لباوصالا.

darija: ghadi ykhSna nzerbo, bda kayTi7 Dlam
eng: We'll have to hurry, it's getting dark already
darija_ar: غادي يخصنا نزربو, بدا كايطيح ضلام

darija: ghadi ndiro kimma guelti o n7awlo nrj3o mnin jina.
eng: We'll do as you said and try to retrace our steps.
darija_ar: غادي نديرو كيمّا ڭولتي أُ نحاولو نرجعو منين جينا.

darija: lla, ila kant 3ndk lkhariTa an9dro nchofo wach kayna chi Tri9 9Ser tkherrejna men hna.
eng: No, if you have the map we could see if there is a shorter route out of here.
darija_ar: اللا, إلا كانت عندك لخاريطا أنقدرو نشوفو واش كاينا شي طريق قصر تخرّجنا من هنا.

darija: ghadi ykhSona sway3 bach nrj3o mnin jina, f DDlam, o f wsT ga3 had lghiss ...
eng: It will take us hours to get back the way we came, in the dark, and through all that mud ...
darija_ar: غادي يخصونا سوايع باش نرجعو منين جينا, ف الضلام, أُ ف وسط ڭاع هاد لغيسّ ...

darija: bessa7, m3a had chta dial had Sba7, lerD mghiyssa.
eng: Sure, with the rain from this morning, the ground is very muddy.
darija_ar: بسّاح, معا هاد شتا ديال هاد صباح, لرض مغييسّا.

darija: walakin bla bawSala s3ib t3rf mnin trj3 wakha bl khariTa.
eng: But without a compass it's hard to know which way to return even with the map.
darija_ar: والاكين بلا باوصالا سعيب تعرف منين ترجع واخا بل خاريطا.

darija: walakin melli 7na men ljanoub, kanDen ghadi ndowzo hadchi...
eng: But since we're from the south, I think we'll get through this...
darija_ar: والاكين ملّي حنا من لجانوب, كانضن غادي ندووزو هادشي...

darija: o ghadi ymken tchouf Tri9 wla lvilaj men lfo9.
eng: Then we may be able to see the road or the village from the top.
darija_ar: أُ غادي يمكن تشوف طريق ولا لڤيلاج من لفوق.

darija: ghir nwSlo Tri9 ghadi ykon hadchi sahel.
eng: Once we rach the road it will be easy.
darija_ar: غير نوصلو طريق غادي يكون هادشي ساهل.

darija: ila Tl3na f had lhaDaba ghadi tweli 3ndna choufa meziana o l vilaj aykon mDowwi idan ghadi nchofoh b sohoula bach n3rfo l ittijah li anmchiw fih.
eng: Going up on that hill will give us the right visibility and the village will be lit up so we can spot him easily to go in the right direction.
darija_ar: إلا طلعنا ف هاد لهاضابا غادي تولي عندنا شوفا مزيانا أُ ل ڤيلاج أيكون مضووّي إدان غادي نشوفوه ب سوهولا باش نعرفو ل إتّيجاه لي أنمشيو فيه.

darija: ila l9ina l7jer ghadi nkono flblaSa lmonassiba
eng: If we find the rocks we should be in the right place
darija_ar: إلا لقينا لحجر غادي نكونو فلبلاصا لموناسّيبا

eng: I'm not sure I want to throw up rocks.

darija: mtaf9, zeffan bl7jer maghadi yddina l ta blaSa.
eng: I agree, throwing rocks around will get us nowhere.
darija_ar: متافق, زفّان بلحجر ماغادي يدّينا ل تا بلاصا.

darija: ghadi ykhSna n7tafDo 3la TTa9a dialna 3la 9bel Tel3a o nnezla.
eng: We need to save our energy for the climb and the long walk down.
darija_ar: غادي يخصنا نحتافضو علا الطاقا ديالنا علا قبل طلعا أُ النزلا.

darija: walakin f jami3 l7alat, hadchi mezian 9errebna l villaj.
eng: But anyway, it's nice we almost got to the village.
darija_ar: والاكين ف جاميع لحالات, هادشي مزيان قرّبنا ل ڤيلّاج.

darija: katban chwia fchkel, wach nta bikhir?
eng: You look a little worried, are you ok?
darija_ar: كاتبان شويا فشكل, واش نتا بيخير?

darija: makay3jbnich nTir ga3 fach ykon ljow khayb b7al lyouma.
eng: I don't like to fly at all on bad weather like today.
darija_ar: ماكايعجبنيش نطير ڭاع فاش يكون لجوو خايب بحال ليوما.

darija: rah s3iba walakin rah sm3ti l ga3 t3limat dial aTTa9am idan rak derti ga3 dakchi li f sTiTa3tek.
eng: It is difficult but you ve listened to all the instructions from the crew so you have done everything you can
darija_ar: راه سعيبا والاكين راه سمعتي ل ڭاع تعليمات ديال أطّاقام إدان راك درتي ڭاع داكشي لي ف سطيطاعتك.

darija: atta3limat dial aTTa9am makat3awnch bezzaf fach katkon khayf TTir!
eng: Instructions from the crew don't help much when you're afraid of flying!
darija_ar: أتّاعليمات ديال أطّاقام ماكاتعاونش بزّاف فاش كاتكون خايف الطير!

eng: They can't do anything about the turbulence!

darija: 3reft annaha s3iba b nisba lik 7it lkhl3a o lojik makaytjm3och 3adatan
eng: I know it is difficult for you as fear and logic don't always go hand in hand
darija_ar: عرفت أنّاها سعيبا ب نيسبا ليك حيت لخلعا أُ لوجيك ماكايتجمعوش عاداتان

darija: tbghi tl3eb alkarta bach matb9ach tfekker f hadchi?
eng: Would you like to play a card game to take your mind off it all
darija_ar: تبغي تلعب ألكارتا باش ماتبقاش تفكّر ف هادشي?

darija: ayeh, lojik assara7a bghatna ndkhlo l rasna anna aTTiyara hia aktar wasila dial anna9l aman.
eng: Yes, actually the logic would want us to get in the head that the plane is the safest transport.
darija_ar: أيه, لوجيك أسّاراحا بغاتنا ندخلو ل راسنا أنّا أطّييارا هيا أكتار واسيلا ديال أنّاقل أمان.

eng: Or why don't you suggest something

darija: hadi hia ll3ba lwa7ida li kan3rf
eng: It's the only game I know!
darija_ar: هادي هيا اللعبا لواحيدا لي كانعرف

darija: walakin goul lia, makatbanch lia mstrissi bezzaf.
eng: But tell me, you don't seem very stressed.
darija_ar: والاكين ڭول ليا, ماكاتبانش ليا مستريسّي بزّاف.

darija: ghadi njbed lkarTa diali men daba da9i9a
eng: I ll get my cards out in a minute
darija_ar: غادي نجبد لكارطا ديالي من دابا داقيقا

darija: kanrkeb f Tyara bezzaf ghir 7awl matfekertch bezzaf fl ms2ala
eng: I fly quite often and just try not to think about the process too much
darija_ar: كانركب ف طيارا بزّاف غير حاول ماتفكرتش بزّاف فل مسألا

darija: kanDen annaho aham 7aja hia annaho s3ib matkounch kat7ekkem f kolchi
eng: I think the main thing is that it is difficult not to be completely in control
darija_ar: كانضن أنّاهو أهام حاجا هيا أنّاهو سعيب ماتكونش كاتحكّم ف كولشي

eng: It is similar to having an operation

darija: mat9der illa annak tti9 fl bennaj
eng: You just have to trust the anaesthetist
darija_ar: ماتقدر إلّا أنّاك التيق فل بنّاج

darija: lli mezian fl3amalia howa annak katkon na3es fiha!
eng: The upside with an operation is that you sleep during!
darija_ar: اللي مزيان فلعاماليا هووا أنّاك كاتكون ناعس فيها!

darija: nta msafer 3la 9bel lkhdma dialk wla ghir tourist?
eng: Do you travel for your work or a tourist?
darija_ar: نتا مسافر علا قبل لخدما ديالك ولا غير توريست?

darija: mora TTer7 dial lkarta kayban lia nmchiw ncherbo chi 7aja o n7awlo nne3so
eng: After our game maybe we should both have a drink and try to sleep
darija_ar: مورا الطرح ديال لكارتا كايبان ليا نمشيو نشربو شي حاجا أُ نحاولو النعسو

eng: I ll get the cards now

darija: wla ghir nne3so o safi, thella f rask daba
eng: Maybe we should just sleep, bye for now
darija_ar: ولا غير النعسو أُ سافي, تهلّا ف راسك دابا

darija: ayeh, chi kwiyess dial l9hwa ghadi ynf3ni mezian.
eng: Yes, a good cup of coffee will do me great.
darija_ar: أيه, شي كوييسّ ديال لقهوا غادي ينفعني مزيان.

eng: Come on, let's start the game.

darija: FaTima, 3afak khelini nfekker fih, baghi nrta7.
eng: Fatima, please let me worry about it, I want to rest.
darija_ar: فاطيما, عافاك خليني نفكّر فيه, باغي نرتاح.

darija: yallah nemchiw nDerbo chi dwira o nTl3o f dik lkodia lli temma.
eng: Let's go for a walk and climb that hill over there.
darija_ar: يالّاه نمشيو نضربو شي دويرا أُ نطلعو ف ديك لكوديا اللي تمّا.

eng: That will give you something to rest for.
darija_ar: هادشي غادي يعتيك بعدا علاياش تساراح.

eng: It's very nice, you should try
I can't just lie by the pool.
darija_ar: مانقدرش نبقا ڭالس حدا لا پيسّين.

darija: ma3ndkch chi ktab wla chi chabaka?
eng: Don't you have a book or crossword puzzles?
darija_ar: ماعندكش شي كتاب ولا شي شاباكا?

darija: n9der n3tik ktab dial arrosoum, jebt m3aya ktab dial arrosoum
eng: I can give you a comic book, I've brought a comic book.
darija_ar: نقدر نعتيك كتاب ديال أرّوسوم, جبت معايا كتاب ديال أرّوسوم

darija: ila mchina ntmechaw daba ghadi ngless b houdou2 f jenb la pissine lmoddat neS sa3a men b3d.
eng: If we go for the walk now I will lie quietly by the pool for 30 minutes afterwards.
darija_ar: إلا مشينا نتمشاو دابا غادي نڭلسّ ب هودوء ف جنب لا پيسّين لمودّات نص ساعا من بعد.

eng: I won't bother you at all.

darija: ghadi ntmechaw lmoddat sa3a o neS o men b3d maghadich yb9a lina 7ta lwe9t bach nrj3o l la pissine.
eng: We're gonna walk for an hour and a half and then we won't even have time to get back by the pool.
darija_ar: غادي نتمشاو لمودّات ساعا أُ نص أُ من بعد ماغاديش يبقا لينا حتا لوقت باش نرجعو ل لا پيسّين.

eng: If you want us to walk tomorrow

darija: ghadi nb9a saket ghir 20 da9i9a Safi.
eng: I will only stay quiet for 20 minutes.
darija_ar: غادي نبقا ساكت غير 20 داقيقا صافي.

darija: o men be3d, kanwa3dek ghadi nkon morafi9 7sen fl3oTla.
eng: And then, I promise, I'll be a nicer vacation companion.
darija_ar: أُ من بعد, كانواعدك غادي نكون مورافيق حسن فلعوطلا.

darija: sme7 lia ma7amelch nriyeb l7efla, walakin rani 3iyan dial beSSa7.
eng: I'm sorry to be such a party pooper, but I'm really tired.
darija_ar: سمح ليا ماحاملش نرييب لحفلا, والاكين راني عييان ديال بصّاح.

eng: Ok I'll get the orange juices.

darija: o men b3d kanwa3dek ankhellik 3la ra7tek o nmchiw ghedda ntmechchaw ghir chwia.
eng: Then I promise to leave you alone and we will go for a shorter walk tomorrow.
darija_ar: أُ من بعد كانواعدك أنخلّيك علا راحتك أُ نمشيو غدّا نتمشّاو غير شويا.

darija: kay3jbni la pissin, walakin maghadich nb9aw hna l3chia kamla!
eng: I like the pool, but we're not gonna be here all afternoon!
darija_ar: كايعجبني لا پيسّين, والاكين ماغاديش نبقاو هنا لعشيا كاملا!

darija: mabitich tmchi tDrb Tl3a Sghira ljbl?
eng: Don't you want to take a little hike?
darija_ar: مابيتيش تمشي تضرب طلعا صغيرا لجبل?

darija: ayeh, ayeh, dowzna tlata dial sway3 f lapissin.
eng: Yeah, yeah, we spent three hours at the pool.
darija_ar: أيه, أيه, دووزنا تلاتا ديال سوايع ف لاپيسّين.

eng: I'm getting a little bored, aren't you?

darija: mafhmtch kifach ymken tkon fer7an o nta makaddir walo lmoddat sa3at.
eng: I don't understand how you can be happy about doing nothing for hours.
darija_ar: مافهمتش كيفاش يمكن تكون فرحان أُ نتا ماكادّير والو لمودّات ساعات.

darija: idan biti tb9a galess hna tani?
eng: So you want to stay here again?
darija_ar: إدان بيتي تبقا ڭالسّ هنا تاني?

darija: lla lla, mabaghich nmchi bo7di, hadchi ma3ndo ta m3na.
eng: No no, I don't want to go alone, it's absurd.
darija_ar: اللا اللا, ماباغيش نمشي بوحدي, هادشي ماعندو تا معنا.

darija: o merra khra, fach tbghi ddir 7ajat mkhtalfin, katl9a rask kaddir lli bghiti.
eng: But once again, when you want to do different things, you end up doing whatever you want.
darija_ar: أُ مرّا خرا, فاش تبغي الدير حاجات مختالفين, كاتلقا راسك كادّير اللي بغيتي.

darija: kan7ess annaho nta mamSowwe9ch l dmaghi.
eng: I feel like you don't give a shit about my mind.
darija_ar: كانحسّ أنّاهو نتا مامصووّقش ل دماغي.

darija: iwa daba maymkench nrta7 wana 3arfk ma rach9ach lik.
eng: Well now I can't relax knowing you're unhappy.
darija_ar: إوا دابا مايمكنش نرتاح وانا عارفك ما راشقاش ليك.

darija: ach ban lik f wa7d l ittifa9?
darija_ar: أش بان ليك ف واحد ل إتّيفاق?

darija: nmchiw nTl3o lfo9 dial jbel o nsowlo l7akim dial lghaba achno ban lih khaSna ndiro.
eng: We could walk up that mountain and ask the wise man of the woods what he thinks we should do.
darija_ar: نمشيو نطلعو لفوق ديال جبل أُ نسوولو لحاكيم ديال لغابا أشنو بان ليه خاصنا نديرو.

eng: Who's the wise man of the woods?

darija: mo7al wach kayn aSlan walakin 3la l a9al ankouno fo9 jbel kan9elbo 3lih blaSt manb9aw kantna9cho.
eng: Well he probably doesn't exist but at least we would be up a mountain looking for him instead of having this stupid argument.
darija_ar: موحال واش كاين أصلان والاكين علا ل أقال أنكونو فوق جبل كانقلبو عليه بلاصت مانبقاو كانتناقشو.

darija: chokran annak sm3ti lia merra w7da!
eng: Thank you for listening to me for once!
darija_ar: شوكران أنّاك سمعتي ليا مرّا وحدا!

darija: 7biba, 3id miladek men daba chehrayn, khaSna ndiro chi 7fla, ach ban lik?
eng: Honey, it's your birthday in exactly two months, we have to throw a party, what do you think?
darija_ar: حبيبا, عيد ميلادك من دابا شهراين, خاصنا نديرو شي حفلا, أش بان ليك?

eng: Shall we have it at home?

darija: ch7al dial nnass kaDen annaho n3rDo 3lihom?
eng: How many people do you think we can invite?
darija_ar: شحال ديال الناسّ كاضن أنّاهو نعرضو عليهوم?

darija: makrehtch ndiro chi glissa khaSSa, ghir S7abna l9rab.
eng: Well I would quite like an intimate gathering, just our close friends.
darija_ar: ماكرهتش نديرو شي ڭليسّا خاصّا, غير صحابنا لقراب.

darija: walakin rah noubtek bach tkhtari, rah 3id miladek, f nihayat lmaTaf!
eng: But it's your turn to choose, it's your birthday, after all!
darija_ar: والاكين راه نوبتك باش تختاري, راه عيد ميلادك, ف نيهايات لماطاف!

eng: Can we have a menu please
Can you hold this for me?
Do you know how much it costs?
Have you eaten at that restaurant?
He likes juice but he doesn't like milk
darija_ar: هووا عزيز عليه لعاصير والاكين ماكايحملش لحليب

eng: I'd like a table near the window
I'd like to call the United States
I'll have a cup of tea please
darija_ar: غاناخود واهد كاس ديال أتاي عافاك

eng: I'll have a glass of water please
darija_ar: غاناخود واهد كاس ديال لما عافاك

eng: I think I need to see a doctor

darija: rah kayn chi tffa7at f ttllaja
eng: There are some apples in the refrigerator
darija_ar: راه كاين شي تفّاحات ف التلّاجا

darija: kayna wahd resTora lhih, walakin makanDench zwina
eng: There's a restaurant over there, but I don't think it's very good
darija_ar: كاينا واهد رسطورا لهيه, والاكين ماكانضنش زوينا

eng: We'll have two glasses of water please
What would you like to drink?
What would you like to eat?
Would you ask him to come here?
Would you like coffee or tea?
Would you like something to drink?
Would you like to go for a walk?
Would you like to watch TV?

darija: wach ghadi takhod Tyyara ola tran?
eng: Are you going to take a plane or train?
darija_ar: واش غادي تاخود طيّارا أُلا تران?

eng: Do you go to Ourika often?
Do you want to come with me?
Do you want to go with me?
Has your brother been to Paris?
How long have you been here?

darija: ch7al hada bach nta f 9Sbat tadla?
eng: How long have you been in Qasbat tadla?
darija_ar: شحال هادا باش نتا ف قصبات تادلا?

eng: How long have you lived here?
How many children do you have?
How many languages do you speak?
How many people do you have in your family?
darija_ar: شحال ت الناس عندك ف عاإلتك?

eng: I have pain in my arm

eng: Oh, yeah, that's a good idea.

darija: Oh, imken chi haja mzyana ma9dertch nchdha mn b3d.

And thank you for the chocolate bar

darija: ah ana kangol bli hada sb3.

eng: All those French things, always being noticed.
Yes I was pulling your leg.
You deserve to put up with me.
Then I promise to leave you alone
You have a one track mind.
They don't call you Einstein for that
No they don't call you Einstein at all.

darija: 3andi aghlabya t nnas f email o hadi ghatkoun assra3 Tari9a.

darija: hadi bddebT hya l3otla li bghit.
eng: This is exactly the vacation I wanted.

darija: piscine, chamch o tta haja khra.
eng: A swimming pool, sun and nothing else.

eng: The city, I see it the rest of the year!

darija: ah, walakin zwin mara mara tglss fchi blassa trta7.
eng: Yeah, but it's nice every once in a while to land somewhere and relax.
darija_ar: أه, والاكين زوين مارا مارا تڭلسّ فشي بلاسّا ترتاح.

eng: But we relax the rest of the year.

And those kids keep splashing me!

eng: You can go if you want, and you come back for me

eng: They think it's really funny to spray water at me.

eng: I can't read when the pages are wet.

eng: How about we put wheels on your sunbed and I push you around town on it.
darija_ar: أش بان ليك إلا حاتينا روايد ديال ناموسييا ديالك أُ أنا ندافعك فڭاع ناواحي ديال لمادينا

eng: It would be like a rickshaw!
And what would I look like?

darija: jib liya pisin akhor f lmadina
eng: Get me another pool in town.

darija_ar: قاقدر هير تكّا ف شامش أُ تهادن

darija_ar: أُ مازال نقدرو ندورو ف لمادينا ماجموعين!

eng: Hello Lhossein, how are you today?
I'm old, and all my bones ache
darija_ar: أنا شارفا, أُ ڭاع عدامي كايدرّوني

darija: wach hdarti m3a lfrmlia o m3a tbib?

darija_ar: واش هدارتي معا لفرمليا أُ معا تبيب?

darija_ar: إخسار السانسور عمّرو كان لواقت لموناسيب!

eng: I'd actually rather present my pitch directly to you.
darija_ar: فلواقيع كانفادال ندير لعارد ديالي قدامك.

eng: What do you want us to do?
Even if it's a bad time

darija: knt ghadi ngolik bli kan 3lik t9a3ad daba nit.
eng: I was going to suggest that you retired immediately.
darija_ar: كنت غادي نڭوليك بلي كان عليك تقاعاد دابا نيت.

eng: Please don't take this the wrong way.
darija_ar: عافاك ماتاخودش هادشي ب تاريقا غالات.

eng: I'm not taking this the wrong way

darija: walakin makan3rafch kifach nkhrj mn sansour khasr
eng: but I don't know how to pull out of an elevator down
darija_ar: والاكين ماكانعرافش كيفاش نخرج من سانسور خاسر

darija: nta katsna3 okatSmmam lmaSa3id walakin hada kaykhsr kolla nhar
eng: You make and design elevators but this one breaks every day
darija_ar: نتا كاتسناع أُكاتصمّام لماصاعيد والاكين هادا كايخسر كولّا نهار

darija: lbiro dyalna kayn ftaba9 rba3mia okhasni ntla3 droj kolla nhar
eng: Our office is on the four hundredth floor and I have to take the stairs every day
darija_ar: لبيرو ديالنا كاين فتاباق رباعميا أُخاسني نتلاع دروج كولّا نهار

darija: rah hir S7abni wach nta bghiti forSa bach dafa3 3la rask
eng: I just thought you'd like the chance to defend yourself
darija_ar: راه هير صحابني واش نتا بغيتي فورصا باش دافاع علا راسك

eng: Is it getting hot in here?
Let's try to find a solution.

darija: ola bghiti tastafad mn lmaw9if bach tdwwz wa9t mazyan m3a b3Dyatna obla i3tida2
eng: Or do you want to take advantage of the situation to have a good time together and without aggression?
darija_ar: أُلا بغيتي تاستافاد من لماوقيف باش تدوّز واقت مازيان معا بعضياتنا أُبلا إعتيداء

darija: achmn w9t zwin liknti katfakr fih
eng: What sort of good time did you have in mind?
darija_ar: أشمن وقت زوين ليكنتي كاتفاكر فيه

darija: kan dima 3ndi chi 7aja lnas dyal solta
eng: I have always had a thing for people in authority
darija_ar: كان ديما عندي شي حاجا لناس ديال سولتا

darija: matfata7, momkin, walakin fblasa day9a bzaf
eng: Open-minded, perhaps, but in a very confined space.
darija_ar: ماتفاتاح, مومكين, والاكين فبلاسا دايقا بزاف

eng: I'd prefer a stubborn spirit in an open space.
darija_ar: كانفادل روح عانيدا ف فاضاء لمافتوح

eng: Perhaps we could get a drink together?

darija: mohim, kan7as b7ala kayn chi barra f sansour
eng: Well, I feel like there's a bar in the elevator.
darija_ar: موهيم, كانحاس بحالا كاين شي بارّا ف سانسور

eng: I don't know how we're gonna get out

darija: kandn khask, bSiftk ra2is, dir chi 7aja bch t7bas 9ti3 do
eng: I think you should, as a boss, do something to make these blackouts stop!
darija_ar: كاندن خاسك, بصيفتك راإس, دير شي حاجا بش تحباس قتيع دو

darija: ana khayf man9darch ndir chi haja kbira
eng: I'm afraid there's very little I can do
darija_ar: أنا خايف مانقدارش ندير شي حاجة كبيرا

darija: rah hadart m3a lmajlis, walakin homa kaylomo hir ljaw
eng: I've spoken to the council, but they just blame the weather.
darija_ar: راه هادارت معا لماجليس, والاكين هوما كايلومو هير لجاو

darija: makandnch bila rah mas2ala dyal lw9t.
eng: I don't think it's a matter of time.
darija_ar: ماكاندنش بيلا راه ماسألا ديال لوقت.

eng: It can't cope with the heat

darija: ila kan nniDam 9dim o fat 3lih lw9t, fa hada rah mochkil dyal mowadafin 3ndek, yak?
eng: If the system is old and outdated, it's security issues for your employees, right?
darija_ar: إلا كان النيضام قديم أُ فات عليه لوقت, فا هادا راه موشكيل ديال مووادافين عندك, ياك?

darija: kaysta7a9 lmlayn dyal dolarat bach ya7mina
eng: It deserves to spend millions of dollars to protect us
darija_ar: كايستاحاق لملاين ديال دولارات باش ياحمينا

eng: We are just a small business

darija: momkin tan9as mn flos likatchad bach t3awn flkhlaS
eng: Perhaps you could take a pay cut to help pay?
darija_ar: مومكين تانقاس من فلوس ليكاتشاد باش تعاون فلخلاص

eng: Oh, my God, you're really something.
darija_ar: أُه, ياربي, نتا بسّاح شي حاجا

darija: rah 3lina 7na bach nkhllSo flos iSla7at mn Salirat dyalna
eng: It's up to us to pay for the repairs with our salaries!
darija_ar: راه علينا حنا باش نخلّصو فلوس إصلاحات من صاليرات ديالنا

darija: khasak tbda tghawt m3aya bach n3ayto 3la 911
eng: You should start screaming with me to call 911.
darija_ar: خاساك تبدا تغاوت معايا باش نعايتو علا 911

darija: kantlab mank ghir nas dyal SSalir dyalk f 3ichrin 3am jjaya
eng: All I'm asking for is half of your salary for the next twenty years
darija_ar: كانتلاب مانك غير ناس ديال الصالير ديالك ف عيشرين عام الجايا

eng: Otherwise you'll have to use the stairs

darija: makanchof ta mochkil f annani nkhddm ddroj
eng: I don't see any drawbacks to use the stairs
darija_ar: ماكانشوف تا موشكيل ف أنّاني نخدّم الدروج

darija: walakin khasak dir nafs l7aja, ntoma al3chran, diro nafs l7aja
eng: But you're gonna have to do the same, you guys, do the same thing.
darija_ar: والاكين خاساك دير نافس لحاجا, نتوما ألعشران, ديرو نافس لحاجا

darija: kanDn ymkn lik tsta3mal droj ktar chwiya
eng: You look like you could do with using the stairs a bit more
darija_ar: كانضن يمكن ليك تستاعمال دروج كتار شوييا

darija: kayn bzaf mn l9ada dyalna kay3aniw mn lghold o ro9 3la droj mosta3ara dyalna
eng: There are also many of our leaders who are fat and skinny on borrowed stairs!
darija_ar: كاين بزاف من لقادا ديالنا كايعانيو من لغولد أُ روق علا دروج موستاعارا ديالنا

darija: rah wa7d lmra rba7t sayid lkawn
darija_ar: راه واحد لمرا رباحت ساييد لكاون

darija: mtwada3 o kanftakhr biha, bkol woDou7
eng: Modest and proud of it, obviously.
darija_ar: متواداع أُ كانفتاخر بيها, بكول ووضوح

darija: khlina nchofo wach kay3jabhom lkhobz lbyad wla l9a8wi
eng: Let's see if they prefer white or brown bread
darija_ar: خلينا نشوفو واش كايعجابهوم لخوبز لبياد ولا لقاهوي

darija: kan9tara7 n3tiw lhad lmajmo3a lbyad, o lmjmo3a lokhra l98wi
eng: I suggest we give this group some white, and brown to this other group
darija_ar: كانقتاراح نعتيو لهاد لماجموعا لبياد, أُ لمجموعا لوخرا لقهوي

darija: sma3t bila lkhobz kan khayb lbaTT
eng: I heard that the bread was bad for the ducks
darija_ar: سماعت بيلا لخوبز كان خايب لباطّ

darija: daba n9dro n9arno lkafa2a dyal lkhobz lbyad o lkhobz lk7al 3la lbaT
eng: Now we can compare the efficiency of white bread and the black bread on these ducks
darija_ar: دابا نقدرو نقارنو لكافاأ ديال لخوبز لبياد أُ لخوبز لكحال علا لباط

darija: ah, hadi mo2amara kaydiroha charikat dyal biskwit
eng: Yes, that is a conspiracy spread by firms that produce crackers and biscuits
darija_ar: أه, هادي موأمارا كايديروها شاريكات ديال بيسكويت

eng: They want to feed the ducks with cookies?

darija: mkalakh, ghlid bzaf o mal7 bzaf
eng: It's stupid, it's too fat and too salty.
darija_ar: مكالاخ, غليد بزاف أُ مالح بزاف

eng: At least the bread is healthy!

darija: rah khawi mn so3orat l7arariya, kaykhali lbaT ghlid o kayt3arad bzaf lghara9
eng: It is empty calories, which makes the ducks fat and more likely to sink.
darija_ar: راه خاوي من سوعورات لحارارييا, كايخالي لباط غليد أُ كايتعاراد بزاف لغاراق

darija: wakha hakak, y9dar ysabab bzaf dyal do8oun
eng: It could make a lot of fat, though.
darija_ar: واخا هاكاك, يقدار يساباب بزاف ديال دوهون

darija: 3la kol 7al, kayban annaho kaybghiw joj anwa3 dyal lkhobz
eng: Anyway, they seem to like two types of bread
darija_ar: علا كول حال, كايبان أنّاهو كايبغيو جوج أنواع ديال لخوبز

darija: ah y9dar chwiya dyal laft o lbrocolie ykon 7san lihom
eng: Yes maybe some kale and broccoli would be better for them
darija_ar: أه يقدار شوييا ديال لافت أُ لبروكولي يكون حسان ليهوم

eng: Here, the little ducklings are coming!
darija_ar: هنا لفراخ ديال لباط سغيرا جايّين!

darija: ana machi mat2akd wach 3arf ach kayakol lbaT
eng: I'm not even sure I know what the ducks are eating
darija_ar: أنا ماشي ماتأكد واش عارف أش كاياكول لباط

darija: fwa9t bakri mn lmowsim ga3 l azwaj tl baTT ba9i 3ndhom bzaf tl frakh dyal lbaT
eng: Early in the season all of the mating pairs still have lots of ducklings
darija_ar: فواقت باكري من لمووسيم ڭاع ل أزواج تل باطّ باقي عندهوم بزاف تل فراخ ديال لباط

darija: daba kayban liya kay8Dmo lkhobz mzyan
eng: at the moment they seem to digest the bread perfectly
darija_ar: دابا كايبان لييا كايهضمو لخوبز مزيان

darija: tta7di lkbir f lmakla tl bTT kayn framy lkhobz f blays mkhtalfa bach lbaT sghir ta8oa yakhod chwiya
eng: The main challenge in feeding ducks lies in throwing the bread to different places so that even the smaller ducks get some too
darija_ar: التاحدي لكبير ف لماكلا تل بطّ كاين فرامي لخوبز ف بلايس مختالفا باش لباط سغير تاهوا ياخود شوييا

darija: 7ta bin lkbar kaynin mo8ayminin o mo8aymanin
eng: But even among adults there seems to be dominant and dominant
darija_ar: حتا بين لكبار كاينين موهايمينين أُ موهايمانين

darija: chof hada, kol mra kaymchi lTarf dyal lkhobz bach ysra9o lmolah
eng: Look at this one, every time he goes for the piece of bread to steal from his rightful recipient
darija_ar: شوف هادا, كول مرا كايمشي لطارف ديال لخوبز باش يسراقو لمولاه

eng: Are we allowed to fish here?

darija: ah, lbaTT l3odwani aktar kayakhod khobz kter
eng: Yes, the more aggressive ducks get more food
darija_ar: أه, لباطّ لعودواني أكتار كاياخود خوبز كتر

eng: they are better able to dominate the others

darija: kaynin Syada khrin f lwad tahoa
eng: There are fishermen wading in the river as well
darija_ar: كاينين صيادا خرين ف لواد تاهوا

darija: walakin khashom yrado lbal mn lfkarn
eng: but they need to watch out for the turtles
darija_ar: والاكين خاسهوم يرادو لبال من لفكارن

darija: o lbaja3 3odwani bzaf fhad lwa9t mn l3am
eng: And swans are very aggressive this time of year
darija_ar: أُ لباجاع عودواني بزاف فهاد لواقت من لعام

darija: ana kay3ajboni ryoshom lghriba o jlodhom liktchbah nas charfin
eng: I like their little alien heads and their wet skin of old men!
darija_ar: أنا كايعاجبوني ريوسهوم لغريبا أُ جلودهوم ليكتشباه ناس شارفين

darija: kayjiw l7amam mn ba3d o kayaklo lftat dyal lkhobz likayb9a f janb dyal lwad
eng: The pigeons also come later and eat the bread crumbs that are dropped on the river bank
darija_ar: كايجيو لحامام من باعد أُ كاياكلو لفتات ديال لخوبز ليكايبقا ف جانب ديال لواد

darija: fach kant sghir, kra8t bnt 3mmi, kant kaddir fkarn fo9 D8ar8a
eng: When I was little, I hated my cousin, in the country, who sometimes put turtles on her back.
darija_ar: فاش كانت سغير, كراهت بنت عمّي, كانت كادّير فكارن فوق ضهارها

darija: kan kays7abni bila kan basl o 7or
eng: I thought it was totally mean and free
darija_ar: كان كايسحابني بيلا كان باسل أُ حور

eng: And I put them on their feet each time
darija_ar: أُ كانحاتهوم علا رجليهوم كول مرّا

eng: And of course the hawks come for the pigeons
darija_ar: أُ طابعان كاتجي الصوقور علا قبال لحامام

darija: wakha hkak, kanchakk anna so9or kay3jbohom lfkarn
eng: However, I doubt that the hawks are interested in turtles
darija_ar: واخا هكاك, كانشاكّ أنّا سوقور كايعجبوهوم لفكارن

darija: b3d lmarat kaykono m7DoDin o kayakhdo kliyeb wla 9TTa fblasthom
eng: Sometimes they are lucky and get a small dog or cat instead
darija_ar: بعد لمارات كايكونو محضوضين أُ كاياخدو كلييب ولا قطّا فبلاستهوم

eng: That's for the day of the party!
darija_ar: هادا علا قبال نهار ديال لحافلا

eng: Well, the ducks are still here.
We throw them all that's left?

darija: dima kayb9a chwiya dyal lftat f lt7t dyal SSak
eng: There are always some crumbs at the bottom of the bag
darija_ar: ديما كايبقا شوييا ديال لفتات ف لتحت ديال الصاك

darija: ana 3yan bzaf lyoum... dakchi 3lach kangol nb9aw 7da la piscine
eng: I'm really tired today... so I say we stay by the pool!
darija_ar: أنا عيان بزاف ليوم... داكشي علاش كانڭول نبقاو حدا لا پيسسين

darija: wach bssa7 bghiti daye3 l3otla kolha 8na?
eng: Do you really want to waste the entire holiday here?
darija_ar: واش بسّاح بغيتي دايع لعوتلا كولها هنا?

eng: We might as well have gone to our pool.
Oh please can we do something else
darija_ar: أُه عافاك نقادرو نديرو شي حاجا خرا

darija: Sara7a, knfDDl nb9a m3a lwalida mrta7
eng: Honestly, I'd rather stay with my mother in peace
darija_ar: صاراحا, كنفضّل نبقا معا لواليدا مرتاح

darija: nta 3arf mzyan hia makat9darch tmchi bzaf
eng: you know very well she can't walk that much
darija_ar: نتا عارف مزيان هيا ماكاتقدارش تمشي بزاف

darija: n9dro ndiro chi 7aja kat9dar lwalida dyalk dir8a
eng: We can do something that your mother can do as well then
darija_ar: نقدرو نديرو شي حاجا كاتقدار لواليدا ديالك ديرها

darija: imkn liha t9ra ktabha ta7t lparasol o n9adro nbniw l9ila3 bramla
eng: She can read her book under a parasol and we can build sand castles!
darija_ar: إمكن ليها تقرا كتابها تاحت لپاراسول أُ نقادرو نبنيو لقيلاع براملا

darija: 3lach la, walakin mazal kanstamta3 b lmasba7
eng: Why not, but I'm still enjoying the pool.
darija_ar: علاش لا, والاكين مازال كانستامتاع ب لماسباح

eng: Don't you want to do some laps?

darija: rah dart lmi2at dyal dorat lioma
eng: I've already done a couple of hundred laps today
darija_ar: راه دارت لميأت ديال دورات ليوما

darija: ila dart ktar, ghadi nbda nbowwe9
eng: If I do any more I'm going to start going really barmy.
darija_ar: إلا دارت كتار, غادي نبدا نبووّق

darija: o kanb9a ndrab fnas kay3omo bchwiya
eng: And I keep bumping into people swimming slowly
darija_ar: أُ كانبقا ندراب فناس كايعومو بشوييا

eng: A little drink by the bar perhaps?
darija_ar: شوييا ديال شراب حدا لبار إمكان

darija: ghadi nb9a ntfaraj fik kadir dorat dyalk
eng: I'll watch you do your laps
darija_ar: غادي نبقا نتفاراج فيك كادير دورات ديالك

eng: But I don't want to do laps.

darija: bghit nabni 9la3 ramliya, nakol polo, o nmchi tsrkila 3la rjlin
eng: I want to build sand castles, eat lollies, go on a hike.
darija_ar: بغيت نابني قلاع راملييا, ناكول پولو, أُ نمشي تسركيلا علا رجلين

eng: Anything but stay by the pool.
darija_ar: أي حاجا من غير نبقا حدا لاپيسين.

eng: What do you usually do on holiday?

darija: kan9ra, kanrta7, kankhrj nchreb chrab... o nta?
eng: I read, I rest, I go out for a drink... and you?
darija_ar: كانقرا, كانرتاح, كانخرج نشرب شراب... أُ نتا?

darija: kanbni l9ila3 ramliya o kanakol polo o kanmchi ntnaza8 kif glt
eng: I build sand castles eat lollies and go for walks, as I said.
darija_ar: كانبني لقيلاع راملييا أُ كاناكول پولو أُ كانمشي نتنازاه كيف ڭلت

darija: wakha, bghiti tmchi tchrab chi charab f lbar
eng: Well, would you prefer to go to the bar to get a drink?
darija_ar: واخا, بغيتي تمشي تشراب شي شاراب ف لبار

darija: wla n9dar njib lik chi 7aja ila bghiti
eng: Or I could get you something if you want
darija_ar: ولا نقدار نجيب ليك شي حاجا إلا بغيتي

eng: I just don't like staying still
Will you get us some drinks?

darija: ah, ay 7aja katba3ad 3la had lmasba7 khamsa d9ay9
eng: Yes, anything to get away from this poolside for five minutes
darija_ar: أه, أي حاجا كاتباعاد علا هاد لماسباح خامسا دقايق

eng: I'm pretty sure they have just about everything here
darija_ar: أنا ماتأكاد عندهوم كولشي تاقريبان هنا

darija: ila bghiti, t9dar drab dora m3a lkalb tahowa
eng: If you want, you can take a ride with the dog, too.
darija_ar: إلا بغيتي, تقدار دراب دورا معا لكالب تاهووا

darija: ghadi ykhalih y7as 7san, o tkhalih far7an
eng: It'll make him feel better, and it'll make him happy.
darija_ar: غادي يخاليه يحاس حسان, أُ تخاليه فارحان

eng: He looks a bit bored too
A coffee with sugar, thank you

darija: swwl lwalida bach takhod chi 7aja liha 7ta hiya
eng: Ask my mother to get something for her too!
darija_ar: سوّل لواليدا باش تاخود شي حاجا ليها حتا هييا

darija: wakha, wa7ad 98wa, joj mn vodka o martini jayin
eng: Ok, one coffee, two vodka shots and a Martini coming up
darija_ar: واخا, واحاد قهوا, جوج من ڤودكا أُ مارتيني جايين

eng: I'll be back in a minute

darija: mamt2kkdch bila dok lbaT ghadi y3jabhom lkhobz l9dim dyalna
eng: I'm not sure those ducks will love our old bread
darija_ar: مامتءكّدش بيلا دوك لباط غادي يعجابهوم لخوبز لقديم ديالنا

eng: It should soften quite quickly in the water

darija: wakha kansma3 bila lkhobz mazwinch lbaT
eng: Although I do hear bread isn't very good for ducks
darija_ar: واخا كانسماع بيلا لخوبز مازوينش لباط

eng: What did you bring for them?
Peas and green vegetables are better for them

darija: kandn lkhobz kayghre9 o kakhali Daya khayba - dakchi li sm3t b3da
eng: I think the bread sinks and creates a messy pond - so I hear anyway
darija_ar: كاندن لخوبز كايغرق أُ كاخالي ضايا خايبا - داكشي لي سمعت بعدا

eng: There are signs up saying not to give them bread

darija: kanbghi nji l8na wakha hakkak 7it 8adi2 bzaf
eng: I love coming here though as it's very peaceful
darija_ar: كانبغي نجي لهنا واخا هاكّاك حيت هاديء بزاف

eng: Watching the ducks is very soothing
Well, I'm not giving any more bread

you're not always in a bad mood
after the day you've passed, that makes sense

eng: I was thinking about doing this next Saturday
